channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Spreads His Politics of Grievance to Nonwhite Voters
item.description: Eight years ago, he won over many white voters, who were often called the forgotten Americans. Now, he hopes to make inroads with Black and Latino vot...

item.title: Israel’s Security Cabinet to Meet to Discuss Response to Iran Attack
item.description: The cabinet was expected to authorize Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Yoav Gallant, the defense minister, to initiate a retaliatory attack at th...

item.title: Retirees will get $50 more from Social Security every month starting next year—but that’s a drop in the bucket compared to years past
item.description: Over 70 million people receive Social Security benefits.

item.title: Social Security recipients to get $50 bump for 2025 as inflation cools
item.description: After years of high inflation, the COLA is coming back down to earth.

item.title: U.N. Says Israel Opened Fire on Peacekeepers in Lebanon
item.description: Israel’s military said it was looking into the claim. The U.N. force in Lebanon said two peacekeepers were wounded.

item.title: Nima Rinji Sherpa Becomes Youngest Climber to Summit 14 Highest Mountains
item.description: Nima Rinji Sherpa’s achievement highlights the role of Sherpas in an activity where they shoulder much of the risk but receive little glory.

item.title: Most Americans who want to lose weight don’t want to take GLP-1 drugs like Wegovy and Zepbound, new survey says
item.description: Men, Baby Boomers, and postgraduate degree-holders were among those most likely to say they wouldn’t choose medication over dieting.

item.title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Lawyers Accuse Government of Leaking Cassie Assault Video
item.description: The hip-hop mogul’s legal team said in a filing on Wednesday that it may ask for the widely published video to be barred from his trial.

item.title: Democracy Struggles in an Era of Mistrust and Upheaval
item.description: The Athens Democracy Forum last week explored the world’s schisms in the face of threats from technology and shifts in the world order.

item.title: Swiss workers must clock out for bathroom breaks, court rules
item.description: “Swiss law does not mention the right of employees to go to the toilet.”

item.title: A top affirmative action lawyer said that some companies are caving to DEI criticism because ‘they’re wimps’
item.description: Neal Katyal said that many fears over legal retribution are unwarranted.

item.title: Inflation Expected to Cool in September C.P.I. Report
item.description: The Consumer Price Index is moderating, but September’s report contained both good and bad news for policymakers.

item.title: Han Kang Is Awarded Nobel Prize in Literature
item.description: The South Korean author, best known for “The Vegetarian,” is the first writer from her country to receive the prestigious award.

item.title: U.N. Says Israel Opened Fire on Peacekeepers in Lebanon
item.description: Israel’s military said it was looking into the claim. The U.N. force in Lebanon said two peacekeepers were wounded.

item.title: Ukraine’s Parliament Approves Biggest Tax Hike of War to Support the Army
item.description: The authorities are resorting to a politically unpopular move as they scramble to raise funds for the grueling military effort against Russia.
